name: Potato Masher Stainless Steel, Heavy Duty Mashed Potatoes Masher, Best Masher Kitchen Tool for Bean, Avocado, Easy to Clean

title: Lightweight, but effective
content: I needed a masher for our camping gear. I picked this one because it was inexpensive, but I like it because it's lighter weight and smaller than the one I usually use, which makes it perfect for a camping kit, but it still works well.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I use this to mash a lot of foods. The quality is good. It works well. Good price.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023

title: Quality masher
content: It's easy to use light weight
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Mashes potatoes like a potato masher. I didn't think to look at the dimensions so it is a little smaller than I thought. If you're making potatoes for more than two people consistently I'd recommend a bigger one. However this works well for me and my wife. Feels good and mashes well
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020

title: Verified Purchase

title: Surprised me
content: Works as designed, but not a very long handle.  Works for a family of two, but for mashing a huge pail of potatoes for a holiday, handle us not long enough or strong enough to mash 15 pounds. Works for smaller amounts great.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020

title: Verified Purchase
content: Well let me tell you if I would have spotted this product on a store shelf I would have passed it by. It does appear to be well-built but small and dainty and very lightweight.. for small batches of whatever I suppose it would be fine.. but if you're looking to mash potatoes for several people this would not be too comfortable.. as I said it's small and very lightweight and not what I consider a good kitchen tool.. I like a tool with some Stout and some Brawn to it..Arrrr!!! Just my opinion though..
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020

title: Potatoe masher good for family of 2
content: When it comes to hand mashers, this is my gold standard. The metal stands up best, it does not clump or clog as some of the plastic or nylon mashers do, and it is extremely easy to clean. If I need to quickly mash potatoes or other food item, I can get it done within seconds to the consistency I want. Love this!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2020

title: Verified Purchase
content: Well, it does what it does. Smooth as a butter.

title: No Beef in this tool
content: I use a masher like this for hamburger or ground sausage mostly. Browning meat for Sloppy Joes, pizzas, etc. At first I thought this was too small, but it's a dynamo. I don't know why. This thing does a better job than the big clunky chromed steel (That rusted... Yuk) one that it replaced.
